folder: Mott Street & Park Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Mott Street, north from, but not including Park Street, to, but not including Bayard Street.
About 1890.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Mott Street & Park Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Mott Street, north side, east from a point in line of Park Street, to the Chatham Square (right), showing a portion of New York's Chinatown. At the left is the distinctive structure housing the Chinese Empire Reform Association and a Joss House. This is No. 20 Mott St. It also provided entrance to the enclosed passageway to Doyers Street, emerging at the "Bloody Angle". View 2 is a photostatic reproduction of the original.

About 1900
No.s. 1-2

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

text:
13 Mott Street, west side, between Chatham Square and Park Street. The view shows the lower story of building, containing the Mootie Temple.

October 28, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

October 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Chatham Square

folder: Mott Street & Park Street, Manhattan, NY

text:
5 Chatham Square, west side, north of Mott Street, showing the entrance to a motion picture theatre.
1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Chatham Square - [Mott Street]

text:
Foley Square (prominent buildings), as viewed southwest- ward from the elevated station at Chatham Square, showing the Municipal Bldg. and the Federal Courts Bldg. in a set of three views. Appearing in the foreground is the Chatham Square station of the City Hall division, running southward on Park Row; the photographers vantage point being the station for the South Ferry trains.

The turreted, former Corn Exchange Bank building seen, is at the S.E. corner of Worth Street and Park Row. Mott Street is to the right of same and does not appear.

April 24, 1938. Views 1, 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr,
title: Manhattan: Foley Square - 58th Street

folder: Park Row & Chatham Square, Manhattan, NY
text:
Park Row, south from Chatham Square, showing the street level overshadowed by the City Hall division of the 2nd and 3rd Avenue "El" line. In the background are the Municipal and Federal Court House buildings. The photographer's vantage point is the platform of the South Ferry division on New Bowery.

1938-9

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Chatham Square
